16:14 <Enygma`> ClemensR: I think you were among the people suggesting to avoid PR checks in pages and services and write custom API/checks in services, right? Please have a look at http://markmail.org/thread/phps4k7zdgyufnzy and let me know what exactly you were suggesting to do in order to avoid PR checks and "trap-documents"  
16:15 <Enygma`> I am currently facing this issue when trying to implement http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11416 and I need to remove the PR check in the wiki script service to be able to edit wiki descriptors in a subwiki.  
16:25 <ClemensR> Enygma`:  sorry, I have been away a bit, but now having a look  
16:28 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:45 <Enygma`> vmassol: any idea why we have these DB errors in the test logs about integrity constraint violations on XWIKIRCS ?  
16:45 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/RegularUserTest/testWikiLinkSearchedPageHidesTechnicalSpaces/ (scroll at the bottom)  
16:45 <Enygma`> I`ve seen a lot of these in the recent tests and they might be impacting the tests themselves  
16:46 <vmassol> I don't recall seeing that  
16:46 <vmassol> no idea what is causing it  
16:47 <vmassol> I guess it means we're trying to save some data in the DB with the same id than existing data  
17:14 <ClemensR> Enygma`: seems I only thought about that PR checks in the context of the Activity Stream, where all you can do is read data ... in case of write actions the  custom checks in services do not help against these trap pages, however. (They would not help against "trap pages" in the activity stream either, but all a malicious user can do is add lots of activity streams on one page and make that page very slow ... so I did not worry about that, but I guess I shou  
17:15 <ClemensR> so that is why I have not answered to the mail, I am still trying to find a solution for an aspect of the problem I did not understand before  
17:17 <Enygma`> :/ I don`t really see what we could do without signed scripts  
17:24 <ClemensR> I am not even sure if signed scripts will solve all the problems ... they would be responsible e.g. for handling CSRF, too, either.  
17:25 <ClemensR> didn't even know about sdoc, btw ...

18:05 <vmassol> mflorea: question regarding styling. Are we allowing to have several forms on a single admin ui page (ie. in a single section). Note that this means having several "Save" buttons to save each part  
18:05 <vmassol> the idea is that for email, I have 2 config classes for now (with a third one in the future)  
18:06 <vmassol> and right now I'm displaying them on the same admin ui page  
18:06 <vmassol> I guess the correct answer is that we should have a new section in the admin and several config pages. The problem is that this is not supported right now…  
18:06 <vmassol> (with Configurable class)  
18:16 <lucaa> has quit  
18:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <mflorea> vmassol: technically there's no problem to have more forms on the same section, each with its own save button. Best is to use JavaScript to save otherwise you may loose changes from form 1 when saving form 2.  
18:20 <vmassol> you mean I should have only 1 save button?  
18:20 <vmassol> (mflorea)  
18:21 <vmassol> that makes it a lot more complex :)  
18:21 <mflorea> you can have more, but each should save the form without reloading the page, i.e. without  loosing changes from field of other forms  
18:21 <vmassol> ah ok so still using the saveandcontinue action  
18:21 <vmassol> hmmm  
18:22 <vmassol> it also means notifications to the user that it's saved  
18:22 <mflorea> if you reload the page then only the info from the form that contains the save button is submitted  
18:22 <vmassol> yes  
18:22 <vmassol> what I see is that our code is not really meant for this use case  
18:22 <vmassol> I've had to modify AdminFieldsDisplaySheet for example  
18:23 <vmassol> since it didn't support several forms on the same pag  
18:23 <vmassol> \*page  
18:23 <vmassol> this is why I was asking about best practice  
18:23 <vmassol> it feels like this is not part of our best practice to have several forms on the same page  
18:23 <vmassol> and that instead we're usually creating several sections  
18:24 <cjd> has quit  
18:24 <mflorea> yes, it's not common, I haven't seen this done in XWiki before, but technically it's possible  
18:24 <vmassol> there's something slightly similar though on the Search admin ui  
18:25 <mflorea> yes, you can "hide" this by using some tabs  
18:25 <mflorea> each form in a tab  
18:25 <vmassol> indeed, that's another idea but again not part of our "xwiki style guide" I guess  
18:25 <mflorea> but still you need to use save&continue  
18:25 <mflorea> yep  
18:26 <vmassol> so I was hesitating with looking into supporting sections in configurableclass, ATM I don't know how easy it is though  
18:26 <vmassol> ok I'll check this out since it's probably the best solution  
18:26 <vmassol> and if not too complex I'll do it  
18:27 <mflorea> good luck :)
